title: Emilia Jones
text:
Emilia Annis I. Jones (born 23 February 2002) is an English <a href="actress">actress</a>, <a href="singer">singer</a> and <a href="lyricist">lyricist</a>. She is most known for her critically-acclaimed lead role in the 2021 film "<a href="CODA%20%282021%20film%29">CODA</a>" as Ruby Rossi in which she received a <a href="Hollywood%20Critics%20Association">Hollywood Critics Association Film Awards</a> nomination for Best Actress. She is also known for playing Kinsey Locke in the <a href="Netflix">Netflix</a> series "<a href="Locke%20%26amp%3B%20Key%20%28TV%20series%29">Locke & Key</a>" (2020–), while also having additional early roles in television such as "<a href="Doctor%20Who">Doctor Who</a>" and "<a href="Utopia%20%28UK%20TV%20series%29">Utopia</a>", and lead characters in films like "<a href="Brimstone%20%282016%20film%29">Brimstone</a>", "<a href="Ghostland">Ghostland</a>", and "". She also performed in several theatrical productions in the <a href="West%20End%20theatre">West End</a> in London.
Early life.
Emilia Jones is the daughter of Welsh singer and TV presenter <a href="Aled%20Jones">Aled Jones</a> and his English wife Claire Fossett. She has one younger brother, Lucas Jones.
Career.
Jones' acting career began in 2010, aged 8 years old, when she appeared as Jasmine in the film "<a href="One%20Day%20%282011%20film%29">One Day</a>". She portrayed Alice in the <a href="Channel%204">Channel 4</a> drama "<a href="Utopia%20%28UK%20TV%20series%29">Utopia</a>", and later that year played the young Queen of Years Merry Gejelh in the British television series "<a href="Doctor%20Who">Doctor Who</a>" episode "<a href="The%20Rings%20of%20Akhaten">The Rings of Akhaten</a>" (2013). The "<a href="Boston%20Standard">Boston Standard</a>" lauded Jones for "carr[ying] off her scenes with aplomb" and for "really sell[ing] Merry’s mixture of naivety, knowledge and childlike fear," while the website <a href="Zap2It">Zap2It</a> praised Jones' performance for being "spot on." In film, Jones has had small roles in "<a href="One%20Day%20%282011%20film%29">One Day</a>" (2011) and "" (2011).
In 2011, Jones made her theatrical debut after playing the princess Young Fiona in the original cast of "<a href="Shrek%20the%20Musical">Shrek the Musical</a>" at the <a href="Theatre%20Royal%2C%20Drury%20Lane">Theatre Royal, Drury Lane</a>. In 2013, Jones appeared in <a href="Rebecca%20Lenkiewicz">Rebecca Lenkiewicz</a>'s stage adaptation of <a href="Henry%20James">Henry James</a>'s "<a href="The%20Turn%20of%20the%20Screw">The Turn of the Screw</a>". She held the role of nine-year-old Flora with two other girls, alternating between them each night. After her performance on press night, Jones commented, "I don’t find it scary, I just find it so much fun... I love every bit of it."
In December 2018, it was announced that Jones was cast as Kinsey Locke, one of the main characters in the <a href="Netflix">Netflix</a> fantasy drama series "<a href="Locke%20%26amp%3B%20Key%20%28TV%20series%29">Locke & Key</a>" (2020–present). The first season was released on 7 February 2020. This marked Jones' first main role in a television series. She was attracted to the role of Kinsey because of the prospect of being able to play two versions of the same character: Kinsey before she removes her fear, and Kinsey after she removes her fear. Jones stated in an interview about "Locke & Key", "This, for me, was one of the best shoots I've ever done. The cast and crew are incredible and I absolutely adore them."
In 2021, Jones starred in the <a href="Apple%20TV%2B">Apple TV+</a> comedy-drama film "<a href="CODA%20%282021%20film%29">CODA</a>" as Ruby Rossi, the only hearing member of her family who dreams of going to <a href="Berklee%20College%20of%20Music">Berklee</a>. In order to play the part, Jones spent nine months during the shooting of "Locke & Key" learning sign language extensively, while also learning how to operate a professional fishing trawler. The film premiered on 28 January 2021 at the <a href="2021%20Sundance%20Film%20Festival">Sundance Film Festival</a> where it was bought by Apple for $25 million. The film premiered on Apple TV+ on 13 August 2021, with the film receiving overwhelming positive reviews, and Jones garnering critical acclaim for her performance.
Her upcoming film is a psychological thriller titled "<a href="Cat%20Person%20%28film%29">Cat Person</a>" directed by <a href="Susanna%20Fogel">Susanna Fogel</a>.
